In another victory for common sense and the Constitution, late last week U.S. Federal District Court Judge Benitez ruled that California's gun rules and bans are unconstitutional and deprive law-abiding citizens of rifles commonly allowed in other states.

From Judge Benitez - "The Second Amendment is about America's freedom: the freedom to protect oneself, family, home, and homeland."

I can't agree more! And I hope to see California appeal this to the Supreme Court (and lose) so that these unconstitutional bans can be struck down nationwide once and for all.

name: Thomas Massie
content:
Recently, I had the opportunity to visit Arrick's Propane in South Portsmouth at the invitation of the owner, Ralph Arrick. It was a pleasure to tour the facility, meet with the employees, and hear about the legislative agenda of the National Propane Gas Association and the Kentucky Propane Gas Association.

As a member of the House Committee on Transportation and Infrastructure, I was interested to hear how Arrick's Propane customers are increasingly using propane as an alternative fuel source for transportation needs. To underscore this point, Mr. Arrick showed me a van he customized that runs on both propane and gasoline.

Propane offers a number of economic and environmental benefits. In my off-the-grid home, the clothes dryer, cookstove, on-demand hot-water heater, and backup generator all run on this fuel. Until we see big improvements in battery technology, propane is the best complement to residential solar installations because it's domestically produced, easy to store, clean-burning, and has a high energy density. Arrick's Propane employees were pleased about the extent to which I use their preferred fuel source. They asked me to join the Congressional Propane Caucus, which I am happy to do since propane is a clean source of energy that we don't have to import from other countries!
text: recently opportunity visit arricks propane south portsmouth invitation owner ralph arrick pleasure tour facility meet employees hear legislative agenda national propane gas association kentucky propane gas associationas member house committee transportation infrastructure interested hear arricks propane customers increasingly using propane alternative fuel source transportation needs underscore point mr arrick showed van customized runs propane gasolinepropane offers number economic environmental benefits offthegrid home clothes dryer cookstove ondemand hotwater heater backup generator run fuel see big improvements battery technology propane best complement residential solar installations domestically produced easy store cleanburning high energy density arricks propane employees pleased extent use preferred fuel source asked join congressional propane caucus happy since propane clean source energy dont import countries

name: Doug LaMalfa
content: It was an honor to attend the Opening Ceremonies for the 127th Annual California State Sheriff’s Association Conference hosted here in Butte County. I enjoyed hearing the Keynote speaker, Dr. David Black who gave a powerful presentation on the importance of officer wellness. A couple of troubling statistics shared were, Law Enforcement officers are exposed to on average more than 200 critical incidents compared to 1 or 2 for the average civilian during their career. 1 in 12 officers have considered suicide in the past year. In these very difficult times I will continue to stand up for, fight for, and thank, the men and women of law enforcement for their sacrifices.

content:
This guy was arrested and is to face trial for wire fraud and lying to U.S. authorities. He was a scientist at the Univ. of Tennessee, participating in federally funded research on nanotechnologies.

The problem, however, is that he was also privately running a similar operation over in China. He's accused of hiding this inconvenient fact from U.S. authorities. All this means that this guy was able to funnel our nation's intellectual property over to the Chinese government.

This happens all too frequently. There's essentially a free flow of sensitive and classified research funded by American taxpayers into the possession of our global competitors and adversaries. And communist China is one of the worst offenders.

That's why I recently introduced legislation on this front, which would require that visa sponsors notify the Department of Homeland Security (DHS) whenever a visa recipient participates in federally funded research. And it also gives DHS the ability to revoke that visa if the individual is considered to be a risk to homeland security, national security, or the research integrity of his/her sponsor.

You can read more about my bill here: http://bit.ly/sus-research-act

http://bit.ly/anming-hu

WBIR.COM
UT researcher arrested, charged with wire fraud, making false statements about relationship with Chinese university
text: guy arrested face trial wire fraud lying us authorities scientist univ tennessee participating federally funded research nanotechnologiesthe problem however also privately running similar operation china hes accused hiding inconvenient fact us authorities means guy able funnel nations intellectual property chinese governmentthis happens frequently theres essentially free flow sensitive classified research funded american taxpayers possession global competitors adversaries communist china one worst offendersthats recently introduced legislation front would require visa sponsors notify department homeland security dhs whenever visa recipient participates federally funded research also gives dhs ability revoke visa individual considered risk homeland security national security research integrity hisher sponsoryou read bill wbircomut researcher arrested charged wire fraud making false statements relationship chinese university

content: BIG NEWS: Today, the Senate voted to pass legislation I worked on with Sen. Cory Booker banning the sale of shark fins. name: James Lankford
content:
The US Innovation and Competition Act-\-\or #China Bill-\-\ is not focused, strategic, or affordable. The bill was supposed to limit China’s rising influence around the world, but this bill will require borrowing money from China before we can implement the plan to limit China.

The communist Chinese government remains the greatest economic and security challenge facing our nation and the free world. We should have a serious and intentional debate on trade, national security, energy, supply chains, environmental damage, and human rights in China, instead of this random collection of policy ideas.

The central control of innovation and production advocated in this bill gives the impression that we are trying to ‘out China,’ China. We became the strongest economy in the world through our freedom, not our central management. We should partner universities with private businesses to spark innovation, increase our own development of critical minerals, aggressively negotiate trade agreements around the world, and isolate Chinese companies for their clear human rights violations.

US businesses face relentless hacking attempts, intellectual property theft, and a strangle hold on the critical mineral supply chain. China commits horrible human rights abuses against religious minorities and workers of all ages, and they have stripped the freedom and autonomy of our friends in Hong Kong. We should confront the real threat from China, but we should be smart about how we do it. I will continue to work toward solutions that counter China’s rising influence and make us less dependent on Beijing in the future.

name: Roy Blunt
content:
Over the past five months, our committees have worked together in a bipartisan way to thoroughly investigate the intelligence and security failures prior to and on January 6, and to develop recommendations to address them.

These recommendations are based on an extensive fact-finding effort that included interviews with key decision makers, firsthand accounts from law enforcement personnel, and the review of thousands of documents.

Our focus now should be on immediately implementing these recommendations.

We owe it to the brave men and women who responded that day to do everything we can to prevent an attack like this from ever happening again, and in every instance ensure that the Capitol Police have the training and equipment that they need.

BLUNT.SENATE.GOV
Blunt, Klobuchar, Peters, Portman Release Bipartisan Report Investigating January 6th Capitol Attack | U.S. Senator Roy Blunt of Missouri

The pandemic has made clearer than ever that it’s time we stop funding an education system that excludes parents and hurts disadvantaged children. Instead, we need to ensure that our education funds are actually made available to students and families of all stripes and that they are empowered to use them in a way that best meets their unique needs.

name: Mike Garcia
content:
I am on the ground in #CA25 today as local, state, and fed law enforcement conduct the largest operational raid in LA County history. This raid is historic progress to combat the illegal marijuana grows in the region.

These grows, largely run by transnational criminal organizations and worked by 90-95% illegal immigrants, are fueled by the #BidenBorderCrisis.

I am pleased to see the progress we are making on this issue today. However, to further combat this problem we must secure the border.

In Congress, I am also working to address the current overtime cap placed on law enforcement officers which hinders their ability to provide enforcement on this issue as often as needed.

As an Appropriator in Congress, I will continue to fight against radical calls to defund the police. We must ensure that our law enforcement receive support and funding necessary.

Thank you to all law enforcement officials involved today - especially Alex Villanueva, L.A. County Sheriff and Los Angeles County Sheriff's Department officials for your work.

I will continue to do all I can to support efforts to combat the illegal marijuana grows in California and will continue to work with local, state, and federal officials on this issue.

name: H. Morgan Griffith
content:
The House of Representatives met in pro forma session today. During these brief sessions, which sometimes have only the acting Speaker and one other Member present, legislation can be advanced by “unanimous consent.” While a power of the House, it should not be used to advance significant legislation.

Today I was present during the pro forma to make sure unanimous consent was not abused as a substitute for the hard work of legislating and voting on tough issues.

name: Alan S. Lowenthal
content:
Today, I re-introduced the America’s Red Rock Wilderness Act. This legislation will permanently protect more than 8.4 million acres of public lands in Utah by designating these areas as official federal wilderness. We will be able to safeguard these precious lands by ensuring they remain in their natural state, continue to allow for hunting, fishing, and camping, and preclude destructive industrial uses such as logging, coal mining, or oil and gas fracking. I am also proud that my bill is cosponsored by 56 of my House colleagues, as well as the Southern Utah Wilderness Alliance in Utah, the Sierra Club, and the Natural Resources Defense Council.

https://lowenthal.house.gov/media/press-releases/congressman-lowenthal-introduces-legislation-protect-federal-lands-utah

LOWENTHAL.HOUSE.GOV
Congressman Lowenthal Introduces Legislation To Protect Federal Lands In Utah As Wilderness

name: J. Hill
content:
President Biden appointed Vice President Kamala Harris as his border Czar 76 days ago - she has still not been to our southern border.

In the time it took her to make her current trip to Guatemala and Mexico, hundreds of thousands of illegal immigrants have entered our country as a result of President Biden’s weak immigration policies.

In April alone, 178,000 migrants were encountered by U.S. Border Patrol, the most in a single month since FY2000.

In my seven trips to the southwest border, I have never seen a worse situation than I did during my recent April visit. Drug smuggling, human trafficking, and weapon trafficking into the U.S. is increasing after Biden hastily revoked many of President Trump’s national security policies, like the “Remain in Mexico” policy and construction of the border wall, giving immigrants leeway to enter the U.S.

In February, cartels raked in over $14 million a day from human trafficking -- an urgent situation putting Americans in danger.

The Biden Border crisis rages on – it’s about time the president's Border Czar actually visited the border.

name: Brian Higgins
content:
It is clearly the beginning of the end of the border shutdown between the U.S. and Canada. In conversations with government leaders on both sides of the border we are learning plans are moving forward to provide for expanded crossing allowances. Action is long overdue.

Later this week President Biden and Prime Minister Trudeau will travel to meet in England for the G7. And accommodations were made to allow U.S. and Canadian hockey teams to come together for the Stanley Cup finals. Science and progress in fighting the pandemic have made this possible.

If we can do it for some, we can surely find a way to do it for all. Families have been separated for over a year, homeowners have been kept from their property, and our economies have suffered. Leaders on both sides of the border must get this done.

https://www.reuters.com/world/americas/canada-soon-say-how-it-will-ease-curbs-us-border-fully-vaccinated-citizens-pm-2021-06-08/

REUTERS.COM
Canada to unveil measures soon to ease U.S. border curbs for fully vaccinated

name: Patrick T. McHenry
content: President Biden recently announced his budget and it is another bad deal for Americans. The President’s budget plan adds $17 trillion in new debt over ten years—that is $63,700 per U.S. household. And it will raise taxes by $3.6 trillion, the equivalent of $28,800 per household. By 2031, we will be spending more on debt interest payments than the entire Defense budget. Republicans have a plan that will reduce the American people’s tax-burden, balance the budget in five years, and boost American prosperity. Check out the graphic below to see the difference.

name: John H. Rutherford
content:
NOAA recently announced the 2021 South Atlantic red snapper season will be July 9 - 11th. You can find more information from NOAA on how to take advantage of this year's season at the link below.

I am again disappointed by this short season. Constituents tell me they see so many red snapper in our waters, you can almost walk on their backs. Yet, NOAA again only allows access to the fishery a few days a year. The short season highlights the need for NOAA to use better data.

That is why I secured $3.3 million for an independent study of the South Atlantic red snapper fishery, which is currently underway. This study uses innovative research techniques to better report data on the true fish stock, hopefully leading to longer seasons and more days on the water for our anglers in Northeast Florida.

FISHERIES.NOAA.GOV
NOAA Fisheries Announces Limited Openings of Recreational and Commercial Red Snapper Seasons in South Atlantic Federal Waters
text: noaa recently announced south atlantic red snapper season july 11th find information noaa take advantage years season link belowi disappointed short season constituents tell see many red snapper waters almost walk backs yet noaa allows access fishery days year short season highlights need noaa use better datathat secured million independent study south atlantic red snapper fishery currently underway study uses innovative research techniques better report data true fish stock hopefully leading longer seasons days water anglers northeast floridafisheriesnoaagovnoaa fisheries announces limited openings recreational commercial red snapper seasons south atlantic federal waters

name: Sean Patrick Maloney
content: Our farmers not only produce world-class fruits, vegetables, dairy and agricultural products - they feed our communities and drive our local economies. Today, I toured R & G Produce, LLC in the Black Dirt region of Goshen. Like so many HV family farms, R&G has struggled to navigate a year of depressed prices and limited markets, causing them serious financial strain. They need more help from the federal government to keep their operation running. I’m introducing the Relief for Small Farmers Act to do just that. This bill is designed to help farmers get back on their feet by offering a one-time debt forgiveness of up to $250,000. Farming is the lifeblood of our local economy, and we need to make sure it’s a big part of our recovery.

name: Chris Van Hollen
content:
When it comes to technology, standing still means falling behind. So I am pleased that the Senate passed a major bipartisan bill to help boost innovation and grow jobs in Maryland and across the country while curtailing the theft of trade secrets and meeting the rising global challenge of China. I was proud to author a number of provisions in this bill – including measures to stop foreign companies from stealing key U.S. technologies and identify the most important challenges in science and technology that we must tackle. I’m glad to see the Senate take this sweeping action -- next stop: the House of Representatives!

NYTIMES.COM
Senate Overwhelmingly Passes Bill to Bolster Competitiveness With China

name: Lucille Roybal-Allard
content:
The Supreme Court ruled this week that those who were granted Temporary Protected Status (TPS) aren't eligible to seek permanent residency. Many TPS holders play essential roles in their communities. This decision underscores the need to provide them with a pathway to citizenship.

My bill, the #DreamAndPromiseAct, amends the law to ensure that TPS holders can become legal permanent residents and eventually citizens. I urge the Senate to take action, pass my bill, and send it to Pres. Joe Biden's desk.

Esta semana, la Corte Suprema dictaminó que aquellos quienes se les otorgó el estatus de Protección Temporal (TPS) no son elegibles para la residencia permanente. Muchos beneficiarios de TPS desempeñan un papel esencial en sus comunidades. Esta decisión subraya la necesidad de proporcionarles un camino hacia la ciudadanía.

Mi proyecto de ley, la #ActadeSueñoyPromesa, enmienda la ley para garantizar que los beneficiarios de TPS puedan convertirse en residentes permanentes y eventualmente ciudadanos. Insto al Senado que actúe, que aprueben mi proyecto de ley y que lo envíen al escritorio del Pres. Joe Biden.

name: David Rouzer
content:
May’s jobs report included 100,000 fewer jobs than most experts estimated, underscoring that President Biden’s policies are delaying a full economic recovery following the COVID-19 pandemic. If things continue at this disappointing rate, it will take an entire year to get our economy back to its pre-COVID performance.

Several things are at play here. For one, job creators are staring at potential huge tax hikes and more costly regulations as part of the Green New Deal initiatives of this White House. To a job creator, this means less potential for growth, which means there is no incentive to hire beyond what is absolutely necessary. Much higher energy costs and inflation eat into the bottom line as well. And to top it all off, many job creators can’t find enough workers to keep the same hours operationally as they were pre-COVID.

According to NFIB’s monthly jobs report, nearly half of small business owners are unable to fill job openings. This report further proves that excessive unemployment benefit payments and stimulus checks are the driving incentives (meaning there are some other factors too that are more limited in their effect) for workers to stay home.

name: Raúl M. Grijalva
content:
Supplemental Security Income has long been a last resort and a critical safety net for keeping seniors and those with disabilities from falling into poverty.

8 million Americans rely on SSI, but the benefits are below the poverty line.

It’s ridiculous that for almost fifty years, we have largely failed to make basic updates to ensure the program does what it was intended to do – meet basic needs for blind, disabled, and aged people who will otherwise go without.

I introduced the SSI Restoration Act today to make critical updates to the program to keep beneficiaries out of poverty. #DemolishDisabledPoverty

I had a great conversation with members from the various chambers across the 5th Congressional District. We discussed the need for PPP funding reform, post-Covid recovery for small businesses, the multiple services my office can offer to folks in our community, and other important issues. Thank you to Deb Miller from the Woodland Park Chamber, Terri Hayes from Tri-Lakes, Rachel Beck from the Colorado Springs Chamber, James Flowers from Fountain Valley, Dave Ahrens from Eastern Plains, Janet Brugger from the Black Chamber of Colorado Springs, and Lola Wolach from the Southern Colorado Women's Chamber for taking time out of your busy schedules and joining my team and me. The Pikes Peak region is home to a wealth of small businesses, and I am grateful that they have such knowledgeable and robust support available to them.

name: Ken Calvert
content:
Yesterday I joined Lake Elsinore officials and the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers to commemorate the signing of an agreement to move forward with the Lake Elsinore Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration project feasibility study. The lake is already home to a number of recreational activities today and there are tremendous future opportunities that would follow ecosystem restoration efforts. I’m confident we can all work together to benefit the lake’s water quality, ecosystem, and improve this tremendous asset for the future of Lake Elsinore.

Los Angeles District, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers
9 hrs ·

To mark a step forward in the effort to restore the aquatic habit in Lake Elsinore, California, the Los Angeles District took part in a virtual commemoration of the signing of the Feasibility Cost Sharing Agreement for the Lake Elsinore Continuing Authorities Program 206 Aquatic Ecosystem Restoration.

This agreement is between the U.S. Army Corps of Engineers and the Elsinore Valley Municipal Water District, with additional local partnership from the City of Lake Elsinore and the Riverside County Flood Control and Water Conservation District.

Pictured (left top to right bottom): Top row: Jason Uhley, general manager and chief engineer for the Riverside County Flood Control and Water Conservation District; Col. Julie Balten, LA District commander; Daria Mazey, project manager and lead planner with the Regional Continuing Authorities Program Production Center, U.S. Army Corps of Engineers; and Lake Elsinore Mayor Bob Magee. Middle Row: Darrell Buxton, chief of the Civil Works Branch for the LA District; (together) General Manager Greg Thomas, Director Phil Williams, and Government Relations Officer Greg Morrison of the Elsinore Valley Municipal Water District; and Elizabeth Fiocchi, chief of Programs and Project Controls with the LA District. Bottom row: Rep. Ken Calvert of the 42nd Congressional District; Michael Luecker, planner with the LA District; and Nicole Dailey, assistant to the city manager with the City of Lake Elsinore.

name: Rodney Davis
content:
Closed-track racing of modified motor vehicles is an important part of our local economy and culture. The popularity of converting motor vehicles into racing cars played a key part in the early days and success of NASCAR. Fans and drivers, whether they are professionals or hobbyists, should have the freedom to participate in modified stock vehicle motorsports uninhibited by federal regulators.

That’s why I’m proud to co-sponsor the bipartisan RPM Act, to ensure this time-honored sport can continue despite recent efforts of the EPA. You can learn more about our legislation below:

Davis Co-Sponsors Bipartisan Legislation to Protect Modified Motor Vehicle Racing from Federal Regulators

name: Lisa Murkowski
content: Industries across Alaska continue to feel the strain of COVID-19, but our hospitals have felt some of the most immediate and direct impacts. I joined the staff of Fairbanks Memorial Hospital for a walk-through of their facility where we talked about what it was like serving on the frontlines throughout the pandemic. I appreciated hearing personal accounts of caring for patients and some of the continued challenges they are seeing due to vaccine hesitancy. More than anything, I thank our hospital administrators, doctors, nurses, and cleaning staff. If you work in the healthcare field, the role you play in keeping our hospitals open and Alaskans healthy is no small feat. Thank you for all you do.

name: James M. Inhofe
content:
Today, the Armed Services Committee held a really important hearing on the United States' approach to strategic competition with China. While military competition with China is serious on its own, China is a full-spectrum threat – and that requires a focused, coordinated response from the full U.S. federal government.

A big part of competing with China is getting our military posture in the Pacific right. Our witness, former Trump official Matt Pottinger, said that by expanding infrastructure west of the Intl Date Line, we complicate the Chinese Communist Party's military strategy and become a more formidable deterrent.

Dr. Sheena Greitens also emphasized China’s technology that enables it to surveil and oppress its citizens, including the Uyghurs and the people of Hong Kong. We need a robust, whole-of-government to stop the spread of Chinese surveillance technology around the world.

Read a transcript of my Q&A with our witnesses: https://www.inhofe.senate.gov/newsroom/press-releases/inhofe-questions-expert-witnesses-about-us-government-strategy-to-compete-with-china
text: today armed services committee held really important hearing united states approach strategic competition china military competition china serious china fullspectrum threat requires focused coordinated response full us federal governmenta big part competing china getting military posture pacific right witness former trump official matt pottinger said expanding infrastructure west intl date line complicate chinese communist partys military strategy become formidable deterrentdr sheena greitens also emphasized chinas technology enables surveil oppress citizens including uyghurs people hong kong need robust wholeofgovernment stop spread chinese surveillance technology around worldread transcript qa witnesses

name: Anthony Brown
content:
The opening of a new UM Capital Region Health hospital in Largo is the culmination of more than a decade of work to meet the health needs of Prince Georgians. This new medical center represents a major step forward for health care in our region, a major upgrade of available services and a new location that is readily accessible for more and more people.

More than ten years ago, we set out to transform health care in Prince George’s and bring a brand new hospital to residents who too often sought care far from home. Never forgetting that lasting change takes time and persistence, we persevered and delivered.

Today is a big day for our communities and our efforts to ensure equity and quality of life for those we serve. Prince George’s is vibrant, resilient, and full of untapped potential and opportunity. Every Marylander deserves quality health care and the opening of this hospital is just the beginning #changeUP

name: Garret Graves
content:
I recently visited the southern border to assess the border crisis in Texas and New Mexico. Check out my remarks from the press conference where I joined colleagues from the Congressional Border Security Caucus.

We need border security and to fix our broken immigration system. Protecting our borders is essential to our national security. A secure border will help prevent illegal crossings, terrorist attacks, and the unlawful trafficking of persons and drugs.

That said, there's no silver bullet solution to border security. In some cases, physical structures such as walls and fencing will secure our border. In other areas, enhanced surveillance, increased border patrols, and other measures will be required. To genuinely secure our border, we must constantly adapt our tactics.

Failure to enforce our laws and secure our borders creates a perverse incentive for people to come here illegally and can cause delays in the process for those who want to come here the right way. I will continue working with the Administration and with my colleagues in Congress to make sure we effectively enforce our immigration laws.
text: recently visited southern border assess border crisis texas new mexico check remarks press conference joined colleagues congressional border security caucuswe need border security fix broken immigration system protecting borders essential national security secure border help prevent illegal crossings terrorist attacks unlawful trafficking persons drugsthat said theres silver bullet solution border security cases physical structures walls fencing secure border areas enhanced surveillance increased border patrols measures required genuinely secure border must constantly adapt tacticsfailure enforce laws secure borders creates perverse incentive people come illegally cause delays process want come right way continue working administration colleagues congress make sure effectively enforce immigration laws

name: Robert Menendez
content:
Today’s approval of the U.S Innovation and Competition Act is an extraordinary victory for America’s global leadership and for those interested in securing a 21st century regional and international order built on progressive values.

As the lead author of the foreign policy section of this package, I'm honored to have seen it through to passage and look forward to continuing to work with my colleagues so that President Biden can sign it into law as soon as possible.

I also applaud the Senate for taking concrete action to address the longstanding lack of oversight over U.S. trade policy by adopting my amendment to establish an Inspector General for the office of the U.S. Trade Representative.

MENENDEZ.SENATE.GOV
Chairman Menendez Statement on Senate Approval of China Legislative Package | U.S. Senator Bob Menendez of New Jersey

name: Warren Davidson
content:
Wise words on #SoundMoney from Kevin Warsh...

“In­fla­tion is scarcely the sole or predom­i­nant pol­icy risk. The scale of govern­ment spend­ing and scope of govern­ment ac­tiv­ity are un­prece­dented. Since the on­set of the pan­demic last Feb­ruary, the Fed has bought 56% of to­tal Trea­sury is­suance of $4.5 tril­lion. The Fed’s as­set purchases rep­re­sent 76% of the cu­mu­la­tive fed­eral fis­cal deficit. And the Biden ad­min­is­tra­tion is propos­ing a $6 tril­lion bud­get for fis­cal 2022, about a third of which would be un­funded.”

WSJ.COM
Opinion | The Fed’s Risky Fill-the-Punch-Bowl Strategy

name: Andy Biggs
content:
ATTENTION HIGH SCHOOL STUDENTS

The offices of Congressman Andy Biggs (AZ-05), Congressman David Schweikert (AZ-06), and Congresswoman Debbie Lesko (AZ-08), are pleased to host a Military Service Academy Conference on Saturday, June 12th from 10am –12pm. The conference will be held at Church for the Nations in Phoenix.

Please RSVP for this event by visiting https://biggs.house.gov/services/conference-rsvp.

This is an excellent chance to listen to representatives of the Air Force, Coast Guard, Merchant Marine, U.S. Military, and Naval Academies as they explain the unique academic, career, and military service opportunities offered by each school. Congressional staff will also be present to explain the required Congressional application and nomination process.

We look forward to seeing you there!

name: Sean Patrick Maloney
content: Today, I announced that I’m introducing the Relief for Small Farmers Act. This bill will direct more help from the federal government to our local farms by offering a one-time debt forgiveness of up to $250,000. I’m proud of the economic relief we’ve provided so far through the Coronavirus Food Assistance Programs, the Paycheck Protection Program, Economic Injury Disaster Loans, and the Restaurant Revitalization Fund, but there is more work to be done to ensure that our farmers can provide for their families the way they provide for us. Thank you, Wagon Wheel Farm, for giving me a tour of your farm and to everyone who joined me on today’s panel. I hear your concerns, and I will take them to Washington as I fight to get what you deserve.

name: Thomas R. Suozzi
content:
Success! The Demolition of Buildings 1 & 2 at the Northport VA has finally begun!

Yesterday, I met with Col. Matthew Luzzatto, New York District Commander and District Engineer of the US Army Corps of Engineers at the Northport VA to discuss the commencement of the demolition of Buildings 1 & 2.

After years of advocating for the demolition of these decrepit buildings, they are finally coming down! The demolition has finally begun and should be completed by the end of the year. I will keep you apprised of updates from the ACOE as the demolition progresses.

name: Josh Gottheimer
content:
This month, the youngest survivors of the tragic 2018 Parkland shooting will be graduating high school.

I'm thinking about their classmates, like North Jersey native Alyssa Alhadeff, who were not as fortunate. It’s heartbreaking and I can’t imagine the pain their parents experience every day.

That's why I'm leading the charge on bipartisan legislation like the ALYSSA Act, to help protect our schools and communities from gun violence — and I'm doing it for our children.

CNN.COM

name: Lisa Murkowski
content:
Today, on World Ocean Day, we acknowledge the important role that oceans play around the globe. In the Senate, I’ve worked on significant pieces of legislation to keep our oceans healthy—from addressing ocean acidification to cleaning up marine debris—and grow the blue economy. My BLUE GLOBE Act harnesses innovation, takes action to strengthen the federal maritime workforce, and drives the development of new marine technology—advancing data collection and supporting responsible stewardship of America’s oceans and other important bodies of water. Another legislative effort, the National Ocean Exploration Act, authorizes the National Ocean Mapping, Exploration, and Characterization Council, updates national priorities for ocean data collection and exploration, and directs the Council to coordinate and facilitate activities across federal and non-federal entities to advance those priorities.

For more information on the BLUE GLOBE Act, click here: https://bit.ly/3whCTVq

For more information on the National Ocean Exploration Act, click here: https://bit.ly/3w9fs0O

name: John Katko
content:
Alongside Congressman Joe Morelle, Representative Chris Jacobs and Rep. Tom Reed, I led a bipartisan effort in support of the designation of New York’s Finger Lakes region as a National Heritage Area (NHA). If designated as a NAH, the National Park Service (NPS) would coordinate with community organizations and mobilize federal resources to promote the Finger Lakes region’s diverse heritage. This effort aims to support economic development, attract tourists, and promote historic and natural resource conservation in the region.

name: Doug Lamborn
content:
Today, June 8th, we celebrate "Don Stratton Day" in El Paso County. Donald G Stratton, a resident of Colorado Springs up until his death in February 2020, was on the deck of the USS Arizona during the attack on Pearl Harbor when an armor-piercing bomb set off the ship's forward ammunition magazine. Stratton was the only person on the bow of the Arizona to survive the blast.

During Donald's service last February, my office presented Mrs. Velma Stratton and their family with a Congressional Record, to honor the bravery of her late husband of nearly 70 years.

Donald G Stratton
15 hrs ·

Happy Donald Stratton Day 2021! Every June 8, in Colorado Springs is known forever as Donald G Stratton Day, and was also the day his bridge was dedicated. Share with us your favorite memory of Donald, either on a program or in person!
text: today june 8th celebrate stratton day el paso county donald g stratton resident colorado springs death february deck uss arizona attack pearl harbor armorpiercing bomb set ships forward ammunition magazine stratton person bow arizona survive blastduring donalds service last february office presented mrs velma stratton family congressional record honor bravery late husband nearly yearsdonald g stratton15 hrs happy donald stratton day every june colorado springs known forever donald g stratton day also day bridge dedicated share us favorite memory donald either program person

name: Ann Kuster
content:
“If we could get to where people understand and accept mental health issues as easily as we understand and accept physical health issues, then people with mental health issues will more readily come forward and seek the help they need. Until then, they will suffer in silence and feel alone in their illness.”

These heartfelt words from a family who lost their child to suicide speak to the devastating reality of youth suicide and the urgent need to prioritize mental health resources as we recover and rebuild from COVID-19. We can and must do more.

In Congress, I am working across the aisle to bolster access to mental health care for those in the Granite State and across the country to help save lives so no family has to endure the loss of a loved one to suicide.

BOSTONGLOBE.COM
At Dartmouth College, first-year suicides a grim reminder of a year of loneliness - The Boston Globe

name: Tom Cole
content:
Was delighted to personally congratulate Jonathan Kim, Elliott Kmetz, Elena Price and Nathan Wirth this afternoon on receiving and accepting appointments to attend one of America’s esteemed military service academies.

Their selfless desire and willingness to answer the call to serve our country with their talents and intelligence is commendable, and I was honored to play a small part in their journey by nominating each of them for potential appointment. As they enter this next phase of their lives and education, I know these young leaders will continue to make their families, friends, communities and our state proud every step of the way.

The students from the Fourth District of Oklahoma who have received and accepted offers of appointment are listed below under the military academy they will attend.

U.S. MILITARY ACADEMY AT WEST POINT
Elena Price, Lawton – Eisenhower High School

U.S. NAVAL ACADEMY
Jonathan Kim, Oklahoma City – Westmoore High School*

U.S. AIR FORCE ACADEMY
Elliott Kmetz, Norman – Norman High School *
Nathan Wirth, Norman – Norman High School

*Note: Jonathan Kim was also offered an appointment to the U.S. Military Academy at West Point, and Elliott Kmetz was also offered an appointment to the U.S. Naval Academy.

name: Chris Van Hollen
content: Last week, alongside State Senator Shelly Hettleman and State Delegate Dana Stein, I visited Baltimore’s Chizuk Amuno Congregation and discussed their long history of service to Baltimore’s Jewish community – dating back to April 1871. It’s often groups like this who come to the rescue of our most vulnerable in moments of need. The Chizuk Amuno Congregation has demonstrated that truth – particularly during the pandemic – helping members of the greater community weather this storm by providing meals for our first responders, clothing for the poor, and feeding the homeless. I am grateful to them and other places of worship of all faiths for the ongoing support they provide to the most vulnerable in our communities, but especially for rallying help during the pandemic.

name: Derek Kilmer
content:
Today we celebrate World Ocean Day! Growing up on the Olympic Peninsula, I have fond memories of digging for clams, fishing with my brothers and friends, and hiking along the coast – and they’re some of the same experiences I share with my kiddos today! These trips always remind me of the cultural and economic value of protecting our oceans. In our region, we know that the iconic Pacific Ocean draws visitors from across the country and the world - and powers our coastal economies. But we also know from the science that are oceans are in trouble – and we need to take action. That’s why I’m supporting the President’s 30x30 pledge to protect 30% of our oceans by 2030 -– and why I’m leading bipartisan legislation to spur innovative research to better tackle the crisis of ocean acidification. I’ll keep at it!

#WorldOceanDay https://www.nationalgeographic.com/environment/article/oceans-need-protection-now-new-blueprint-may-help-countries-reach-goals

NATIONALGEOGRAPHIC.COM
Oceans need protection now. A new blueprint may help countries reach their goals by 2030.

I am proud to announce that I have helped secure the inclusion of five regional transportation projects into major transportation legislation currently being considered by the House. These five projects, which will improve the lives of people across the 47th District, were brought forward by local government agencies in Avalon, Garden Grove, Long Beach, and Los Angeles County. name: John Garamendi
content:
Right now, the world is witnessing a new nuclear arms race as Russia and China undertake comprehensive modernization efforts simultaneously with the United States. Alarmingly, these dynamics greatly increase the risk of miscalculation and conflict.

As chairman of the Armed Services Subcommittee on Readiness, I have studied this issue at length and worked with key personnel responsible for executing U.S. nuclear modernization efforts. This work has shown me that the risk for nuclear conflict is the greatest it has been in over three decades.

There are several commonsense changes we can make today to our nuclear modernization efforts to build upon the progress the Biden Administration has made and free up much-needed funds while staving off a costly and deadly nuclear arms race. As the chairman of the Armed Services Subcommittee on Readiness, I intend to do everything in my power to chart a new course in our modernization efforts — one that brings us back to a policy of deterrence rather than one of dominance.

THEHILL.COM
The stakes couldn't be higher as Biden prepares his nuclear posture review
text: right world witnessing new nuclear arms race russia china undertake comprehensive modernization efforts simultaneously united states alarmingly dynamics greatly increase risk miscalculation conflictas chairman armed services subcommittee readiness studied issue length worked key personnel responsible executing us nuclear modernization efforts work shown risk nuclear conflict greatest three decadesthere several commonsense changes make today nuclear modernization efforts build upon progress biden administration made free muchneeded funds staving costly deadly nuclear arms race chairman armed services subcommittee readiness intend everything power chart new course modernization efforts one brings us back policy deterrence rather one dominancethehillcomthe stakes couldnt higher biden prepares nuclear posture review

name: Raúl M. Grijalva
content:
There is no justification for communities like Tucson to continue suffering from PFAS contamination on their drinking water while the federal government drags their feet and fails to act.

For too long the Department of Defense has continued to shift responsibility and failed to address PFAS contamination on and near military bases to the detriment of our families, friends, and neighbors in Tucson.

We must look at every possibility for PFAS remediation funds whether it’s a standalone bill, an infrastructure package, NDAA, or an appropriations bill to remedy this issue once and for all.

I will continue working in Congress to get these necessary funds to ensure Tucson residents can drink and utilize their water without fear of contamination.

Increasing contamination causes shutdown of Tucson water treatment plant

name: Daniel Webster
content:
Happy #WorldOceansDay! Florida’s Gulf Coast boasts some of the world’s most beautiful beaches and ocean views. Although our coastline is a world-renown tourist destination, it is no stranger to hurricanes and extreme weather. Responsible management and resilient infrastructure are vital to the communities and marine species our oceans support.

I recently introduced the Community Access to Resiliency Grants Act of 2021 which directs National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) to create and maintain a website with information and links to existing coastal resiliency grant opportunities available to State, Tribal and local governments. I am committed to preserving this precious resource for future generations.

name: Doris O. Matsui
content:
Today is #WorldOceansDay, and it’s another reminder that we must continue to combat #ClimateChange—both for the benefit of marine ecosystems and to protect our communities. Climate-related events are devastating for global biodiversity and communities worldwide.

That’s why, as a member of the Oceans Caucus, I celebrate the reintroduction of Congressman Raul M. Grijalva’s Ocean-Based Climate Solutions Act, which I proudly support. This important legislation will integrate evidence-based approaches to protect our ocean and coastal communities, promote sustainable job opportunities, and support clean offshore energy while reducing the devastating impacts of the climate crisis. It will prioritize just and equitable climate solutions for communities of color, low-income communities, Tribal and Indigenous communities, and territories.

Furthermore, it’s crucial that the Biden Administration includes ocean-based climate solutions in its agenda and plans to fight climate change. The ocean plays a critical role in the climate equation.

#OceanMonth2021

name: Ken Calvert
content:
I’m pleased to see projects in the 42nd Congressional District are receiving a total of $20 million, on top of the federal formula funding that goes to our region, in the Fiscal Year 2022 surface transportation authorization bill that is set to be considered this week by the House Transportation and Infrastructure Committee. Riverside County residents know all too well how desperately we need to invest in transportation improvements to ease the congestion on our freeways and roads. I have worked closely with our local cities and county officials to identify important, eligible transportation projects that need resources to be completed.

There’s no silver bullet to solving our congestion problems, and no single project is the answer. However, I’m hopeful that by continuing to build projects like the Riverside County priorities included in the bill and bringing additional federal resources to our region we can make a positive impact. That’s also why I have broader concerns about some of the programs and priorities Democrats have included in this reauthorization. Far too many federal dollars are being spent on things that will not help us address congestion relief. I’m hopeful that significant changes can be made to the bill before it comes to the House floor for a vote.

The following Riverside County transportation projects were included in the bill after funding requests were submitted and advocated for by my office and local sponsors:

Interstate-15 Corridor Operations Project $3 million: The funding was requested by the Riverside County Transportation Commission to add a southbound auxiliary lane on I-15 between Cajalco Road and Weirick Road to address a major bottleneck and help relieve peak afternoon congestion. Organizations including the Greater Corona Traffic Alliance, the Western Riverside Council of Governments, the Greater Riverside Chamber of Commerce, the Temecula Valley Chamber of Commerce, and the Southern California Association of Governments submitted letters of support for the project.

Scott Road/Bundy Canyon Road Widening Project - $12 million: The funding was requested by the city of Menifee to widen the existing Scott Road/Bundy Canyon road connection between I-15 and I-215 from a two-lane road to a four-lane corridor. The project area links the cities of Wildomar, Menifee, Murrieta and unincorporated areas of Riverside County. According to the city of Menifee, in addition to reducing congestion, the improvement project will significantly improve driver safety and reduce accident fatality along this high traveled, multi-jurisdiction corridor. Organizations including the Southern California Association of Governments, the Menifee Valley Chamber of Commerce, Loma Linda University Medica Center – Murrieta, and the Western Riverside Council of Governments submitted letters of support for the project.

Temescal Canyon Road Widening Project - El Cerrito Segment - $5 million: The funding was requested by the Riverside County Transportation and Land Management Agency to widen Temescal Canyon Road from two to four lanes from north of El Cerrito Road to Tom Barnes Street and includes a 200-foot segment of widening north of Cajalco Road. This is the last remaining segment of Temescal Canyon Road that has not been widened to four lanes. According to a support letter from the city of Corona, “the project will enhance the quality of life in Temescal Valley and have a positive impact on the health and safety of residents, businesses, and visitors.” Organizations including “We Are Temescal Valley,” the Corona Chamber of Commerce, as well as multiple Temescal Valley residents submitted letters of support for the project.

Protecting the health of our oceans is critical to our way of live. World Oceans Day is an important time to emphasize that, but how can we actually do better?

name: Brad Sherman
content:
It is not a far out idea that China did “gain of function” research creating #COVID that could readily infect humans. Could have done it for medical research or to invent bio weapon. What is a far out idea is that it was released intentionally.

A 2018 inspection by the U.S. State Department showed the lab was sloppy and it’s not clear that anyone did anything to change that. They just kept working on dangerous viruses.

https://www.realclearpolitics.com/video/2021/06/03/fauci_far_out_idea_that_china_would_deliberately_create_virus_that_would_kill_their_own_people_and_others.html

name: Dan Sullivan
content:
Many of the preeminent experts and activists on the front lines of the global marine debris crisis are Alaskans, and it’s not difficult to see why. Our state has more coastline than the rest of the United States combined and, as a result, we see the devastating impacts of garbage in the oceans first hand.

My Save Our Seas 2.0 Act established a new Marine Debris Foundation that will support the National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration (NOAA) and other entities in addressing this challenge. NOAA needs the expertise and insights that Alaskans have to make the Marine Debris Foundation a success, which is why I’m strongly encouraging all of those who are interested and qualified to apply. Ultimately, there is a strong case to be made for this foundation to be based in Alaska, but first we need to ensure the perspectives of Alaskans are well represented on the board.

The application deadline is June 30. If you’re interested or want to learn more, click here:

SULLIVAN.SENATE.GOV
Sullivan Urges Alaskans to Apply for New Marine Debris Foundation Board | U.S. Senator Dan Sullivan of Alaska
text: many preeminent experts activists front lines global marine debris crisis alaskans difficult see state coastline rest united states combined result see devastating impacts garbage oceans first handmy save seas act established new marine debris foundation support national oceanic atmospheric administration noaa entities addressing challenge noaa needs expertise insights alaskans make marine debris foundation success im strongly encouraging interested qualified apply ultimately strong case made foundation based alaska first need ensure perspectives alaskans well represented boardthe application deadline june youre interested want learn click heresullivansenategovsullivan urges alaskans apply new marine debris foundation board us senator dan sullivan alaska

name: Jeanne Shaheen
content:
As our economy recovers from the pandemic and we face increasing aggression and manipulation from China, the time to invest in our workforce and competitiveness is now. That’s why today’s bipartisan passage of the U.S. Innovation and Competition Act in the Senate is so monumental. I’m proud my provisions to invest in our national security and workforce were included in the final package – from enhancing diplomatic tools to counter China to investing in innovative STEM education to train the next generation of leaders. I’m eager to work with partners in the House and the Biden administration to ensure this critical legislation to strengthen our economy and security becomes law. Let’s get to work. –J.S.

SHAHEEN.SENATE.GOV
Shaheen Secures NH & National Security Provisions in Landmark Bill to Invest in U.S. Competitiveness & Counter Chinese Aggression | U.S. Senator Jeanne Shaheen of New Hampshire
text: economy recovers pandemic face increasing aggression manipulation china time invest workforce competitiveness thats todays bipartisan passage us innovation competition act senate monumental im proud provisions invest national security workforce included final package enhancing diplomatic tools counter china investing innovative stem education train next generation leaders im eager work partners house biden administration ensure critical legislation strengthen economy security becomes law lets get work jsshaheensenategovshaheen secures nh national security provisions landmark bill invest us competitiveness counter chinese aggression us senator jeanne shaheen new hampshire

name: Don Young
content:
🚨BREAKING🚨

Today, I introduced a bipartisan bill to PERMANENTLY reauthorize the Highly Rural Veterans Transportation Program, which is crucially important to veterans across our vast state. Through it, highly rural veterans can receive NO-COST rides to VA or VA-authorized health care facilities.

I am committed to ensuring that the rural veterans who put their lives on the line for us are not forgotten. Since its creation, I have always supported reauthorizing the Highly Rural Veterans Program. Too often, we as a Congress have engaged more in partisan bickering than legislating. A program as important as this one should not be used as a negotiating tool or to gain political leverage. Our veterans are not props, and they deserve the certainty and peace of mind that comes with permanent reauthorization.

I am very proud to have the support of Rep. Elise Stefanik (R-NY), and Congressman Chris Pappas (D-NH), Chair of the House Veterans' Affairs Subcommittee on Oversight and Investigations. As a veteran myself, I want my friends on both sides of the aisle to know how important this cause is to me. I call on my colleagues to support this bipartisan legislation, and to help up get it across the finish line.

Read more: https://bit.ly/3g7WKBb
text: breakingtoday introduced bipartisan bill permanently reauthorize highly rural veterans transportation program crucially important veterans across vast state highly rural veterans receive nocost rides va vaauthorized health care facilitiesi committed ensuring rural veterans put lives line us forgotten since creation always supported reauthorizing highly rural veterans program often congress engaged partisan bickering legislating program important one used negotiating tool gain political leverage veterans props deserve certainty peace mind comes permanent reauthorizationi proud support rep elise stefanik rny congressman chris pappas dnh chair house veterans affairs subcommittee oversight investigations veteran want friends sides aisle know important cause call colleagues support bipartisan legislation help get across finish lineread

content:
To immigrants, families and allies:

This Immigrant Heritage Month, we celebrate your...
strength,
love,
traditions,

name: Mike Rounds
content:
***Update to Emergency Grazing & Haying Policies***

Historically, emergency Conservation Reserve Program (CRP) grazing and haying requests could only be considered after state and national emergency declarations. However, the emergency CRP practice has been modified since South Dakota last experienced severe drought conditions.

Today, counties are authorized to approve CRP emergency haying and grazing applications outside of the Primary Nesting Season (PNS) of May 1 – August 1 on all practices when any part of the county is in a D2 condition based on the U.S. Drought Monitor. The current drought monitor for counties in South Dakota can be found here: https://droughtmonitor.unl.edu/CurrentMap/StateDroughtMonitor.aspx?SD.

Emergency grazing during the PNS is allowed only when all of the following are met:
• payments are authorized for the county under LFP (D2 for 8 weeks, D3, or D4)
• less than 50 percent of the normal carrying capacity is maintained
• the participants conservation plan is modified to incorporate the 50 percent of normal carrying capacity, and approved prior to grazing.

In these instances, producers in the declared/affected counties and contiguous counties may file a modified conservation plan from the Natural Resources Conservation Services with their local Farm Service Agency (FSA) County Office to request emergency grazing or haying.

Furthermore, FSA may have resources to assist with inadequate water supply for grazing locations.

For more information, contact your FSA County office (https://offices.sc.egov.usda.gov/locator/app) or read additional materials on FSA’s website (https://www.fsa.usda.gov/Assets/USDA-FSA-Public/usdafiles/FactSheets/crp_haying_grazing_factsheet.pdf)

DROUGHTMONITOR.UNL.EDU
| U.S. Drought Monitor

name: Joe Wilson
content:
Last month, I introduced the Organ Donation Clarification Act with Congressman Matt Cartwright. I am grateful to introduce this bipartisan bill to address the organ donation shortage from which our country is suffering.

In 2020, an average of 17 people in the U.S. succumbed to their illnesses every day because they could not survive the wait for a viable organ. In certain parts of the country, the waitlist can be over five years for a kidney. Current law lacks clarity and prevents potential organ donations.

This legislation addresses those issues by removing the hurdles for potential donors and allowing new, innovative ways to increase organ donation. This would not only save taxpayer dollars but, most importantly, it would save lives. I am grateful to my colleague, Congressman Cartwright, for his leadership on this issue, and I look forward to ensuring this bill is passed and sent to the President’s desk.

JOEWILSON.HOUSE.GOV
CONGRESSMEN WILSON, CARTWRIGHT INTRODUCE BIPARTISAN LEGISLATION TO BOOST ORGAN DONATION
text: last month introduced organ donation clarification act congressman matt cartwright grateful introduce bipartisan bill address organ donation shortage country sufferingin average people us succumbed illnesses every day could survive wait viable organ certain parts country waitlist five years kidney current law lacks clarity prevents potential organ donationsthis legislation addresses issues removing hurdles potential donors allowing new innovative ways increase organ donation would save taxpayer dollars importantly would save lives grateful colleague congressman cartwright leadership issue look forward ensuring bill passed sent presidents deskjoewilsonhousegovcongressmen wilson cartwright introduce bipartisan legislation boost organ donation

content:
On Wednesday, June 23, 2021, from 3:00PM-7:00PM ET (Thursday, June 24, 2021, 5:00AM-9:00AM Chamorro Standard Time), the State Health Insurance Assistance Programs (SHIP) National Technical Assistance Center, in partnership with the Administration for Community Living, will host a Welcome to Medicare National Virtual Fair for new Medicare enrollees – people turning 65, retiring, or joining Medicare because of a disability.

This Medicare fair is an opportunity to learn more about Medicare eligibility, enrollment, costs, and coverage options.

Register online and view the agenda by visiting https://www.shiptacenter.org/about-medicare/news.

name: Aumua Amata Coleman Radewagen

Talofa,

Recently, I was able to directly follow up, after a meeting with our Veterans who travel to Honolulu for care and shared their experiences, with leadership at Tripler. name: John Katko
content: I recently spoke on the floor of the House to celebrate the retirement of John McAuliffe, a Central New York native, visionary, and driving force behind the Onondaga Lake cleanup effort. For nearly two decades, McAuliffe oversaw teams of engineers and technicians to dredge pollutants from the bottom of the lake. While there’s still more work to be done, John McAuliffe undoubtedly helped usher in a new chapter in the lake and our community’s history. Today, Onondaga Lake is the site of the Loop the Lake trail as well as the Lakeview Amphitheater, and hosts thousands of boaters, fishers, and nature enthusiasts each year. Central New York thanks him for his work and wishes him the best in his well-deserved retirement.
text: recently spoke floor house celebrate retirement john mcauliffe central new york native visionary driving force behind onondaga lake cleanup effort nearly two decades mcauliffe oversaw teams engineers technicians dredge pollutants bottom lake theres still work done john mcauliffe undoubtedly helped usher new chapter lake communitys history today onondaga lake site loop lake trail well lakeview amphitheater hosts thousands boaters fishers nature enthusiasts year central new york thanks work wishes best welldeserved retirement

name: Ann Kuster
content:
As co-chair of the Bipartisan Congressional Ski and Snowboard Caucus, I’m proud to introduce the Ski Hill Resources for Economic Development (SHRED) Act alongside my colleagues Congressman Curtis, Congressman Neguse, and Congressman LaMalfa to steer more New Hampshire dollars back home by investing fees paid by our Granite State ski mountains into our local forests and communities to help create more year-round jobs and bolster our regional economies for generations to come.

Outdoor recreation and skiing are cornerstones of New Hampshire’s economy and the Granite State way of life, and I will continue working to ensure our mountain communities have the tools they need to thrive.

KUSTER.HOUSE.GOV
Kuster, Curtis, Neguse, LaMalfa Reintroduce Bipartisan Bill to Support Ski Areas as Nation Recovers from COVID-19

name: Neal P. Dunn
content:
FYI Panama City Residents --

City of Panama City - Government
10 hrs ·

⚠ The parking lot for the Marina Civic Center, including the boat ramp at the Panama City Marina, will be closed beginning on Wednesday, June 9 at 8 p.m. through Thursday, June 10 at 5 p.m.

The City will be conducting Dynamic Pressure and Moisture Intrusion Testing at the Marina Civic Center on Thursday in an effort to receive all eligible funding from the Federal Emergency Management Agency (FEMA) for the rebuild of the performing arts center.

Citizens are urged to avoid this area on Thursday, June 10 as testing is expected to cause a considerable amount of periodic wind noise beginning at 8 a.m. for up to eight hours.

You can read more about the testing on the City's website, https://www.pcgov.org/CivicAlerts.aspx?AID=457

name: Jerry McNerney
content:
ATTN TEACHERS :

The United States Patent and Trademark Office has announced its online National Summer Teacher Institute on Innovation, STEM, and Intellectual Property. This professional development opportunity is open to K-12 teachers and is designed to support teachers as they increase their knowledge of concepts of making, inventing, and intellectual property creation and protection. Teachers participating in this program will be able to share what they have learned back at their schools and in their districts - allowing both our teachers and students to pursue bold and innovative ideas.

If you are a teacher I encourage you to apply!

Applications will only be accepted until June 15th and space is limited. To apply, visit: www.uspto.gov/TeacherInstitute

USPTO.GOV
National Summer Teacher Institute

name: U.S. Helsinki Commission
content:
In February 1991, the Helsinki Commission organized a fact-finding mission to Latvia, Lithuania, and Estonia, following the murders of 18 unarmed civilians in Latvia and Lithuania by Soviet Internal Affairs Ministry troops in January of the same year.

The delegation was the largest Congressional delegation to visit the Baltic States in the 50 years since their forcible incorporation into the Soviet Union.

The delegation also met with Boris Yeltsin, then chairman of the parliament of the Russian Federation, and was directly connected to the primary objective of voicing support for the Baltic cause. Yeltsin had publicly condemned the use of force in Lithuania and Latvia, even calling on Russian soldiers to disobey orders to fire on Lithuanians. #HelsinkiComm45

Congressional Visit to Stockholm, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia and Moscow
The Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe decided to visit Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia in mid-February 1991 and to meet with their freely­ elected leaders and government officials for one paramount purpose: in the context of a fact-finding mission, to express U.S. Congressional support...

Congressional Visit to Stockholm, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia and Moscow
The Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe decided to visit Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia in mid-February 1991 and to meet with their freely­ elected leaders and government officials for one paramount purpose: in the context of a fact-finding mission, to express U.S. Congressional support...

Congressional Visit to Stockholm, Latvia, Lithuania, Estonia and Moscow
The Commission on Security and Cooperation in Europe decided to visit Latvia, Lithuania and Estonia in mid-February 1991 and to meet with their freely­ elected leaders and government officials for one paramount purpose: in the context of a fact-finding mission, to express U.S. Congressional support...

See more at
csce.gov

name: Derek Kilmer
content:
Each year the Congressional Art Competition provides students with an opportunity to showcase their artistic abilities and earn a chance to have their artwork shown for a calendar year in the U.S. Capitol Complex in DC. The artwork submitted this year from our region was impressive to say the least - and I want to thank everyone who participated!

I'm thrilled to announce that the winner this year for Washington's Sixth Congressional District is Bremerton High School student Sandie de Moura!! Check out our conversation to meet Sandie and hear about the technique and inspiration that went into her winning piece "Self-Love"
